'''Minccino''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''チラーミィ''' ''Chillarmy'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Cinccino}} when exposed to a [[Shiny Stone]].

==Biology==
[[File:Bianca Minccino cleaning.png|thumb|left|250px|Minccino cleaning]]
Minccino is a furry, gray chinchilla-like Pokémon with scruffs of fur on its head and neck. It has large ears on the sides of its head with red insides partly covered by tufts of fur. It has large, brown eyes and a small, dot-like nose. Its limbs are somewhat rounded and small, and its ears and tail have white tips. The tail is also long and particularly furry. This tail acts like a broom as Minccino uses it to clean its den. It also brushes another Minccino with its tail to greet it. It prefers clean habitats, and it obsesses with cleaning dirty items. It can also use its tail to perform it and its evolution's [[signature move]], {{m|Tail Slap}}. <br clear=left>

==In the anime==
[[File:Bianca Minccino.png|thumb|250px|Minccino in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Bianca's Minccino]]====
{{an|Bianca}}'s Minccino appeared in ''[[BW013|Minccino-Neat and Tidy!]]'', where it was initially a wild Pokémon. It stole Ash's new Badge case in order to clean it, and ultimately got caught in one of Bianca's [[Poké Ball]]s.

====Other====
A Minccino with the ability to {{m|Sing}} appeared in [[PK22]]. This Minccino would frequently sing, causing {{MTR}} and {{TRT}}'s other Pokémon to fall asleep, which would make it angry and puff up, much like {{an|Jigglypuff}}'s role.

Multiple Minccino appeared in ''[[BW111|There's a New Gym Leader in Town!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Minccino debuted in ''[[BW001|In The Shadow of Zekrom!]]'', where it was running alongside some children in the streets of [[Nuvema Town]].

A Minccino belonging to a little boy appeared in ''[[BW019|A Connoisseur's Revenge!]]'', where it was being examined by an S-class [[Pokémon Connoisseur]]. Multiple Minccino were also seen at a [[Poké Mart]].

A Minccino appeared in [[Mannes]]'s garden in ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]''.

Multiple Minccino appeared in ''[[BW056|The Lonely Deino!]]'', under the care of a {{pkmn|Day Care}} owner named [[Bobby]].

Minccino made minor cameo appearances in ''[[BW023|Battling for the Love of Bug-Types!]]'', ''[[BW033|Iris and Excadrill Against the Dragon Buster!]]'', ''[[BW037|A Fishing Connoisseur in a Fishy Competition!]]'', ''[[BW053|A Maractus Musical!]]'', ''[[BW067|Cilan Takes Flight!]]'', and ''[[BW069|Climbing the Tower of Success!]]''.

A Minccino appeared in ''[[BW080|Clash of the Connoisseurs!]]''.

A Minccino physically appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]''. Multiple Minccino also appeared during the [[Swords of Justice (M15)|Swords of Justice]] legend.

A Minccino briefly appeared in the {{OBP|elder|Village of Dragons}}'s flashback in ''[[BW100|A Village Homecoming!]]''.

A Minccino made a cameo in ''[[BW104|Mission: Defeat Your Rival!]]'', under the ownership of [[Katharine]].

A Minccino appeared in a flashback in ''[[BW112|Team Plasma's Pokémon Power Plot!]]''.

Multiple Minccino appeared in ''[[BW118|Secrets From Out of the Fog!]]''.

A Trainer's Minccino appeared in ''[[BW125|Cilan and the Case of the Purrloin Witness!]]''.

A Minccino appeared in ''[[BW127|The Island of Illusions!]]'' in a flashback.

A Minccino appeared in a fantasy or a flashback in ''[[BW134|The Journalist from Another Region!]]''.

Two Minccino appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'', where they were among the Pokémon seen at [[Nebel Plateau]].

==In the manga==
[[File:Juniper Minccino Adventures.png|150px|thumb|Minccino in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Like in the games, [[Professor Juniper]] owns a Minccino. She uses her tail to help with cleaning and first appeared in ''[[PS461|Fussing and Fighting]]''.

A Trainer's Minccino appeared in ''[[PS466|An Odd Speech]]'' and [[PS539]].

A Minccino appeared in ''[[PS483|Special Delivery]]'' as one of the Pokémon competing in {{ci|Nimbasa}}'s [[Pokémon Musical]].

Minccino had a cameo appearance as one of the Pokémon employed by the [[BW Agency]] in ''[[PS488|Growing Pains]]''. 

It also appeared as the pre-evolved form of {{tc|Janitor|Geoff}}'s {{p|Cinccino}} in a flashback in ''[[PS476|A Direct Attack and a Daunting Defense]]''.

A Minccino appeared in a fantasy in ''[[PS507|A Misunderstanding]]''.

==Trivia==
* The [[Poké Toy]] item is based on Minccino's tail.
* It is possible for the Minccino that appears in the "world of Pokémon" intro in {{game|Black and White|s}} to be Shiny.
* Minccino and its evolution Cinccino were designed by [[Atsuko Nishida]].
* Minccino is the only Pokémon to be part of the "world of Pokémon" intro that evolves in its games' sequel, evolving into Cinccino between the events of Black and White and {{game|Black 2 and White 2|s}}.

===Origin===
Minccino is based on a {{wp|chinchilla}}. Its tail may be based on {{wp|feather duster}}s or {{wp|broom}}s, as they use their tails to clean their dens.

====Name origin====
Minccino may be a combination of ''mini'' (referring to its miniature size), ''{{wp|mink}}'' (an animal known for its fur and its use in women's clothing), or ''mince'' (to make smaller), and ''{{wp|chinchilla}}'' or ''{{wp|chino cloth}}''.

Chillarmy is a combination of ''chinchilla'' and ''charm''.
